intro: Flacourtia kinabaluensis, commonly known as the Borneo flacourtia, is a species of flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Borneo. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and small, clustered white or pink flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded habitats at higher elevations. Flacourtia kinabaluensis is of interest to botanists due to its limited distribution and potential ecological significance in its native environment.
